t_maxobject Struct Reference

#include <maxobjectbridge.h>

Collaboration diagram for t_maxobject:

[legend]

Detailed Description

Data structure for the Max external's object instance obj A t_pxobject is used for all instances. This is because a t_pxobject contains a t_object as it's first member, and thus is compatible for both Max and MSP externs. In regular Max externs, the rest of the t_pxobject is simply unused. me This is the Objective-C instance that is wrapped in the Max external. maxobject_class A cached pointer to the class info for doing lookups quickly on class-related information. audio_in If this is an MSP object, then pointers to audio vectors are cached in this array. audio_out If this is an MSP object, then pointers to audio vectors are cached in this array. audioInput Somewhat redunant with audio_in, this is the MaxAudioSignal representation which is passed to the Objective-C class audioOutput Somewhat redunant with audio_out, this is the MaxAudioSignal representation which is passed to the Objective-C class This data structure is the instance of the Max wrapper object for the Objective-C class.
